definition: the luminous celestial body around which the earth and other planets revolve, from which they receive heat and light, which is composed mainly of hydrogen and helium, and which has a mean distance from earth of about 93,000,000 miles (150,000,000 kilometers), a linear diameter of 864,000 miles (1,390,000 kilometers), and a mass 332,000 times greater than earth
a celestial body like the sun : star

the heat or light radiated from the sun                                      
             
             played in the sun all day
one resembling the sun (as in warmth or brilliance)

the rising or setting of the sun                                      
             
             from sun to sun
glory, splendor
in the public eye
in the world : on earth
to expose to or as if to the rays of the sun
to sun oneself
Sunday
the star that the Earth moves around and that gives the Earth heat and light
any star that has planets which move around it
the heat or light produced by the sun : sunshine or sunlight
to sit or lie in the light of the sun especially in order to make your skin darker
the heavenly body in our solar system whose light makes our day and around which the planets revolve
